alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Hancock; Marion; Morrow; Wyandot (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 24 at 1:49AM EDT until August 24 at 2:30AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cleveland has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Marion County in north central Ohio... Wyandot County in northwestern Ohio... Morrow County in north central Ohio... Southwestern Crawford County in north central Ohio... Hancock County in northwestern Ohio... * Until 230 AM EDT. * At 149 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles northeast of Marion to near Upper Sandusky to near Arcadia, moving southwest at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Findlay, Marion, Upper Sandusky, Bluffton, Mount Gilead, Cardington, Forest, Arlington, Ashley, Prospect, La Rue, Arcadia, Rawson, Morral, Vanlue, Waldo, Van Buren, Chesterville, Sparta and Marseilles. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
